This legislation would reauthorize the National Wildlife Refuge System volunteer programs for four years.

America’s 561 National Wildlife Refuges are located in all 50 states and the five territories, including Rappahannock River Valley National Wildlife Refuge in #VA01. They make up 850 million acres of pristine public lands dedicated to the conservation of fish and wildlife.

We have the best men and women in uniform, they should make combat decisions, not Washington.

And I’m convinced that India will be a strong U.S. ally in the region for years to come.
This summer  I met with the Indian Foreign Secretary, Defense Secretary, and Director General of Naval Operations.

I look forward to receiving the details of the Presidents proposals he presented tonight  and how he will add others ideas as we move ahead.
community health centers, free health clinics, geriatrics, nursing homes, general and family practitioners and all others.
I hope the president will not just listen to but include the ideas offered by those who provide healthcare in all areas of practice
I fully agree about malpractice insurance reform. This effort though must be more aggressive than just the use of demonstration projects
I think that any reform must not increase general fund spending or the deficit. #va #tcot #healthbill @healthcaucus
The President has said that he would not sign a bill that is not self supporting and that he would institute spending cuts
I completely agree with President that there are a number of details to be worked out and I look forward to hearing these details. #tcot #va
I look forward to hearing how this exchange will be run.
He has presented the concept of a government run exchange for individuals and businesses to purchase insurance
The idea of not allowing folks to be denied coverage because of a pre existing condition is a good one.
The President is now announcing his the general proposals.
He has pointed out the problems with the current system of which we all agree exist and need fixing. #tcot #va #healthbill
He is now speaking on health care.
The President is in the House and has begun speech talking about the economy.
"orders imediate med malpractice reform projects that could help dr focus on putting their patients first, not on practicing defensive med"
The points include the public health insurance option a government exchange for insurance
The bullet points are under three headlines and include 14 points. #va #tcot @healthcaucus

All votes related to H.R. 1385 - Thomasina E. Jordan Indian Tribes of Virginia Federal Recognition Act have passed by voice vote.
Rep. Jim McDermott is now speaking in support of the VA tribal recognition. I appreciate his support.
"This bill will protect tribal sovreignty and private businesses when it comes to commerce."
"The tribes are important historically and culturaly to VA, and are the tribes which met John Smith when he sailed up the James River."
I am up now on the floor and CSPAN speaking in support of the VA tribes.
Looks like a final vote on passage of the bill will come around 2:30. For these Native Americans it couldn't come sooner.
Rep. Jim Moran the bill's sponsor is speaking in support now. There is a great deal of bipartisan support (esp w. VA members) for this bill.
Rep. Frank Wolf is speaking in support now. But, he has concerns about gambling being allowed; the bill makes sure that is not the case.
Rep. Bobby Scott is now speaking in support of the Tribes bill.
The debate on the House floor on the VA Tribes is on CSPAN right now, so tune in.
We expect to vote later today on this important legislation. Last Congress it passed by a voice vote.
I will be speaking momenterily on the House floor in support of the Virginia Indian Tribal Recognition Act.
Today we expect to vote on the Virginia Tribal Recognition Act. I hope it passes with the same unanimous support as it did in the 110th.

Walberg is saying, "Madame Speaker let us have a vote!"

Blackburn said leadership's efforts include changing to energy efficient light bulbs, not addressing the supply of energy.

Rep. Jeb Hensarling spoke about the need for Congress to address energy issues because of the devastating affect it's having on families.
I spoke about how Americans are feeling the pain at the pump and related it specifically back to folks in the First District.
I just spoke on the House Floor and challenged the Speaker to call us back in session to debate and vote on a comprehensive energy policy.
There is no reason we can't do this. We are innovative and motivated to solve problems in this country.
A constituent likened this situation to the Apollo 13 crisis -- NASA put everything on the table to fix the problem.
I told them I support a comprehensive energy policy, an all of the above policy with all options on the table.
At the Fair on Saturday, folks were asking me why Congress hasn't acted to lower gas prices.
I'm here on the House Floor today to ensure that the energy discussion continues in Washington.
Rep. Steve King is talking and rejecting the assertion by others that energy prices are not affected by supply and demand only speculation.
Rep. Mike Pence just said that Congress has a responsibility to America to address the number one issue in the land.
Conaway says she's the Speaker for the entire House and she owes it to all members to allow the will of the people to be carried out.
Rep. Conaway is speaking about the responsibility of the Speaker to call for a vote on an American energy policy. #dontgo
He said this is the opposite of the Congressional leadership today which refuses to take action for American energy independence. #dontgo
Rep. Jordan is speaking and pointed to John Adams and how the first Congress fought to establish American independence.  #dontgo
He said that this Congress should do the business of the American people- we must have a debate and vote on a comprehensive energy policy.
Rep. Gingrey is now speaking about how the Speaker has turned off the lights and the sound system to quell debate about energy.
Rep. Herger talked about his constituents and how folks that live in his district and work in Nancy Pelosi"s distrct want Congress to act!
Rep. Don Manzullo just gave an impassioned speech about the freedom this nation fought for to have the debate about energy.

Rep. Wolf said this is a travesty for Americans because those resources must be accessible for the economic and strategic needs of the US.

Rep. Musgrave said that the Speaker should allow a vote because it was what the American people want.
Rep. Musgrave relayed stories of constituents and their suffering and called upon the Speaker to allow a vote.
Rep. Cole points out that previous energy bills passed by Congress were vetoed by President Clinton.
Tom Cole is speaking now. Americans are demanding a comprehensive energy policy. Congress must act.

Lynn Westmoreland is speaking about the lack of action by the majority party and the rhetoric they have professed about energy policy.
